title: Question 6

children: A 31-year-old man is evaluated for the acute onset of skin lesions on his inner thighs, as
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

Pink papules and pustules centered on hair follicles are characteristic of folliculitis. The beard, pubic areas, axillae, and thighs are often affected; however, it can appear on any hair-bearing area of skin.
